critique: This executive order focuses on reforming government procurement processes to be more efficient and effective. It emphasizes streamlining rules, promoting innovation, focusing on results, and using commercially available items. There's a focus on best value rather than just low cost, and simplified acquisition procedures. It also aims to improve the procurement workforce through education and clear lines of authority. The order revokes a previous executive order (No. 12352). There is nothing explicitly ideological in the document. It seems to be focused on good governance and efficient use of taxpayer money. There is no mention of immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. The order could be seen as slightly favoring deregulation by streamlining rules, but it also involves government intervention by setting goals and guidelines. It centralizes authority by designating a Procurement Executive and coordinating government-wide efforts.
